page.title: 20Churches in S.E. Guildford
page.content: {St Joseph's Church}was the first Catholic church in Guildford since the Reformation. It was originally a small wooden church in Chertsey Street which was rebuilt in stone in 1881. The new church in York Road was built of brick in 1984. The statue of St.Joseph and the Holy Child holding a lily, which is the symbol of purity, came from the old church. {Christ Church}is the Church of England parish church and was built in 1864. {St Martha's Church}was built by the Normans between 1100 and 1170 using chalk. The church standing today is 80% Victorian and 20% Norman. About 40 people attend services each week. In one year there are about 5 weddings, 5 christenings and 8 funerals. The old bell is believed to be in Guildford Town Hall and is now replaced by a smaller one.
